subject: Writing
title: Chinatown: The Perfect Screenplay
description: A quick, practical guide to Chinatown: The Perfect Screenplay.

hook.text: Screenwriting teachers call Chinatown the most perfectly structured screenplay ever written. Robert Towne agrees.

buildup.text: Robert Towne spent years crafting a noir mystery set in 1930s Los Angeles around real water wars.

discovery.text: The script layers personal betrayal, political corruption, and ecological crime into a single detective story.

twist.text: Director Roman Polanski changed the ending â€” Towne's version was hopeful. Polanski made it devastating.

climax.text: The darker ending made the film a masterpiece. Chinatown proved that a great script can become greater with conflict.

punchline.text: The perfect screenplay was made better by the ending its writer hated.

quiz.question: What real-world issue inspired Chinatown's story?
